@cazo_lo: Yes, I can. Are you sure about cutting "in 9 pieces", tough? It would make encode repulsive to many people.

That sort of things are  in user-domain, so, you should so it. Anyone can:

mp4box -splitx start_time_of_segment:end_time_of_segment movie.mp4

or 

mp4box -splits seconds_in_each_segment movie.mp4

eq. mp4box -splitx 60:120 movie.mp4 would extract one segment 60 seconds long starting on one minute and ending on two minute mark
or
eg. mp4box -splits 120 movie.mp4 would divide 
movie.mp4 in two minute long segments (or long as one wants).

Program MP4BOX is Swiss-Army-knife for mp4, free, open-source and is available for Windows, Linux, Mac and few more  OS. Just Google.

Sorry, another error, just discovered.

The flags for splitting are:
- split seconds
- splits size (in kb)
- splitx Starttime:Endtime (in seconds)

So, instead of  -splits 60 (what would split/divide input  file in gazillion 60 kb segments , use -split instead (and how much each segment should be long, in seconds)
-splits 716800 would divide/split input in 700 MB segments. Well, stuff for calculators.
